page.title: 01TWYFORD,WARKWORTH AREA.
page.content: IT IS QUITE HILLY IN OUR AREA AND WE ALSO WENT OVER THREE HUMP BACK BRIDGES, WHICH IS QUITE UNUSUAL.ONE OF THE BRIDGES GOES OVER A CANAL WHICH COMES FROM OXFORD.THE CANAL IS POPULAR WITH HOLIDAY MAKERS IN BARGES AND BOATS. THERE WAS A RIVER FLOWING UNDERNEATH THE SECOND BRIDGE.THE RIVER WAS RATHER MURKY I DEFINITELY WOULDN'T LIKE TO FALL IN!THE RIVER OCCASIONALLY FLOODS WHICH MEANS THE CROPS GROWN BY CHERWELL VALLEY SILOS IN THIS AREA ARE LIMITED. THERE WAS A RAILWAY LINE TAKING PEOPLE FROM OXFORD TO BANBURY.OUR AREA IS MOSTLY COVERED BY GRAZING LAND,FOR COWS AND SHEEP,AND FARMLAND WITH PLENTY OF TREES.THERE WERE QUITE A FEW FARMS,ONE EVEN HAS A LODGE.AS WE CARRIED ON THROUGH OUR AREA ALONG BUMPY ROADS,WE SAW ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD A SMALL POSTBOX ON A WOODEN POST.
